title: 112_hr1447
content: The "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" may be cited as the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The "Aviation Security Advisory Committee" is established within the Transportation Security Administration to advise on aviation security matters and develop recommendations for improvements. The Advisory Committee, appointed by the Assistant Secretary, submits periodic reports on identified matters and an annual report on activities, findings, and recommendations. The committee consists of up to 27 members representing various interests. The Advisory Committee consists of up to 27 members representing different organizations in the air transportation industry, including air carriers, labor unions, aircraft manufacturers, and airport operators. Members serve voluntarily and are not compensated by the government. The Assistant Secretary can remove a member for cause, and the committee must meet at least semiannually. The Advisory Committee, comprised of up to 27 members from various sectors of the air transportation industry, meets at least semiannually. Additionally, an air cargo security working group within the Committee convenes quarterly to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues and improve existing cargo security initiatives. The General Aviation Security Working Group within the Advisory Committee focuses on transportation security for general aviation facilities, aircraft, and helicopter operations at airports. It meets quarterly, includes experts in general aviation, and is cochaired by Government and industry officials. The Assistant Secretary establishes an airport perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on improving perimeter security and access control procedures at airports. The working group meets quarterly, includes experts in airport security, and is cochaired by Government and industry officials. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to the Advisory Committee. The Advisory Committee, including its working groups, is exempt from the Federal Advisory Committee Act. Definitions for terms like "Advisory Committee," "annual report," "Assistant Secretary," and "perimeter security" are provided in this section. The establishment of an airport perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee is detailed, with a focus on improving security and access control procedures at airports. The House of Representatives passed the Aviation Security Advisory Committee on June 28, 2012.
